discourse_list.title: Talking a little Transparency of Reserves and Uniform Safe Transactions "TRUST " Act

content.content: Recently there has been much discussion about the Stablecoin Transparency of Reserves and Uniform Safe Transactions (“TRUST”) Act. I came across some articles which do a fairly decent job discussing some of the important aspects as to stablecoins.  There are links to the proposed legislation in the articles below:    Forbes    Crypto Banking Is Maturing– Breaking Down The TRUST Act Crypto might be trustless, but trust is needed for broader adoption      See also: Top US Lawmaker Proposes Sweeping Stablecoin Regulation Framework. Obviously this will impacts things in the US. This is one to watch for sure.
Interesting enough, what worries me is if restrictive policies are made on this type of coins. Thanks to defi it could be said that there is easy access to them, could this change?

So much is up in the air. In the states it’s rather disorganized as we have regulators and legislatures all over the place. Recently the SEC took a hit because (imo) its’ a free for all with no clear guidance (see link to article below). SEC Fees Pressure to Define Crypto Assets | PYMNTS.com
Yes, you are right in that all the proposals feel like a road with many slopes that do not go anywhere. Thanks for the article I liked the point of view.
Yes, the problem (or one of the problems) is that things are vague and uncertain in the U.S.
